confirmation.description:
{{ govukPanel({ titleText: "Application submitted", html: "**Reference Number here**" }) }}

Thank you for submitting your application.

We have sent a confirmation email to **Email here**

What happens next

We will:

  • ask the police for evidence
  • use the police evidence to make a decision
  • send our decision to **Email here**
{{ govukWarningText({ text: "You must inform us immediately if any of the information you have given us changes, especially your address, telephone number or email address.", iconFallbackText: "Warning" }) }}

You can contact our Customer Service Centre on 0300 003 3601. Select option 8 when the call is answered.

What did you think of this service? (takes 30 seconds)

Check your inbox

Reasons for delay in reporting crime

applicant-impact-on-you.description:
On the next page we will ask you to select an option based on how the crime affected you.

We appreciate that this may be difficult for you.

If you need help or support

You can contact us for help with your application on 0300 003 3601. Select option 8.

Our phone lines are open Monday to Friday 8.30am to 5pm except Wednesday when they open at 10am.

You can get practical or emotional support depending on where you live:

  • in England and Wales visit the Victim and Witness Information website
  • in Scotland visit the mygov.scot website

applicant-declaration.description:
By continuing you confirm that the information you will give is true as far as you know.

{{ govukWarningText({ text: "If you deliberately give false or misleading information, you may get less compensation or be prosecuted.", iconFallbackText: "Warning" }) }}

you-need-to-ccontact-us.description:
We need to check if you are eligible for compensation.

Call us on 0300 003 3601. Select option 8.

Our phone lines are open Monday to Friday 8.30am to 5pm except Wednesday when they open at 10am.

errorMessage.maxLength: Title must be 6 characters or less
Last name must be 70 characters or less
First name must be 70 characters or less

required.q-applicant-are-you-18-or-over: Select yes if you are over 18

errorMessage.maxLength: County must be 60 characters or less

Second line of address must be less than 60 characters

q-applicant-when-did-the-crime-start.description: For example, 03 2018. You can enter an approximate date.

errorMessage.format: Enter the date the crime started and include a month and year

required.q-applicant-when-did-the-crime-start: Enter the date the crime started and include a month and year

required.q-applicant-who-are-you-applying-for: Select Myself if you are the person applying for compensation

q-applicant-when-did-the-crime-happen.description: For example, 31 3 2018. You can enter an approximate date.

errorMessage.format: The date the crime happened must be in the past

required.q-applicant-when-did-the-crime-happen: Enter the date the crime happened and include a day, month and year

errorMessage.maxLength: Award amount must be 50 characters or less

q-when-will-you-find-out.title: When will you find out?
q-when-will-you-find-out.description: Enter an approximate date, for example, December 2019. If you do not know you can say so.

errorMessage.maxLength: When will you find out must be 50 characters or less

q-applicant-who-did-you-apply-to.title: Who have you applied to or received compensation from?

required.q-applicant-who-did-you-apply-to: Enter who you applied to or received compensation from
required.q-applicant-has-a-decision-been-made: Select yes if you have received a decision about the other compensation claim

required.q-applicant-where-did-the-crime-happen: Select England, Scotland, Wales or Somewhere else

q-applicant-telephone-number.title: Enter your telephone number
q-applicant-telephone-number.description: We may use this to contact you if we need to clarify something on your application form.

errorMessage.maxLength: Telephone number must be 20 characters or less

required.q-applicant-telephone-number: Enter a telephone number, like 01632 960 001, 07700 900 982 or +44 0808 157 0192

you-cannot-get-compensation.description:
If the crime has not been reported to the police we can not pay compensation.

You may continue your application, but any future application for the same injuries will be refused.

q--when-was-the-crime-reported-to-police.title: When was the crime reported to the police?

you-need-a-different-service.description:
To complete your application use our current online service.

{{ govukDetails({ summaryText: "If you need help or support", html: '

You can contact us for help with your application on 0300 003 3601. Select option 8.

Our phone lines are open Monday to Friday 8.30am to 5pm except Wednesday when they open at 10am.

You can get practical or emotional support depending on where you live:

  • in England and Wales visit the Victim and Witness Information website
  • in Scotland visit the mygov.scot website
' }) }}

q-offender-do-you-know-the-name-of-the-o.title: Do you know the name of the offender?

required.q-offender-do-you-know-the-name-of-the-o: Select yes if you know the offender's name

p-applicant-select-the-option-that-appli.title: Select the option that applies to you

oneOf.title: Option 2: Sexual assault or abuse and other injuries or losses

q-applicant-option.title: Select the option that applies to you

applicant-your-choices.description:
We decide what enquiries to make depending on how the crime affected you.

Option 1: Sexual assault or abuse

Any compensation we pay acknowledges the emotional distress the crime caused you.

We normally make a decision based on your application and the information we get from the police.

Option 2: Sexual assault or abuse and other injuries or losses

We can also pay compensation for:

  • lost earnings because you were unable to work
  • physical injuries
  • pregnancy, sexually transmitted disease or loss of foetus
  • disabling mental injuries that are additional to the emotional distress you already suffered

{{ govukDetails({ summaryText: "What is a disabling mental injury?", text: "A disabling mental injury has a substantial adverse effect on your ability to carry out normal day-to-day activities. For example, reduced performance at school or work, or effects on your social or sexual relationships." }) }}

We may ask a psychiatrist or clinical psychologist to confirm that you have a disabling mental injury if you do not already have a diagnosis.

We will usually make a decision within 12 months. This is because we may need to examine your medical records, get medical reports and assess any losses.

{{ govukDetails({ summaryText: "If you need help or support", html: '

You can contact us for help with your application on 0300 003 3601. Select option 8.

Our phone lines are open Monday to Friday 8.30am to 5pm except Wednesday when they open at 10am.

You can get practical or emotional support depending on where you live:

  • in England and Wales visit the Victim and Witness Information website
  • in Scotland visit the mygov.scot website
' }) }}
